ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Has He chosen daughters over sons?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Does He prefer sons to daughters?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Did He choose daughters rather than sons?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Has He chosen daughters in preference to sons?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “Has he chosen daughters instead of sons?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Has He (then) chosen daughters rather than sons
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Has He chosen daughters in preference to sons?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Has He chosen daughters above sons?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: (And again of their falsehood): He hath preferred daughters to sons.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Has He chosen daughters over sons?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Hath He chosen daughters above sons?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Has He preferred daughters to sons?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Did He (then) choose daughters rather than sons?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Has He (then) chosen daughters rather than sons?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Has He chosen daughters above sons?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: So He preferred girls over boys?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Has He chosen daughters over sons?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [37:153] Has He preferred daughters to sons? (read a’stafā, ‘has He preferred’, indicating an interrogative [hamza], which stands in place of the omitted conjunctive hamza).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: ((And again of their falsehood): He hath preferred daughters to sons
